intro: Leucothoe subcanescens, commonly known as the eastern flame-azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, often with a bluish-gray underside. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
